data.title: Scientists Find A “Weak Spot” In HIV That May Pave the Way to a Vaccine

India just proposed an oil-for-drugs deal with Venezuela, Country is facing severe shortages of even basic supplies such as food, water and medicines, desperately short of medical supplies, lacking as much as 80 percent of what it needs to treat its population
An Australian priest is fighting to abolish the gay panic defence, which allows a murderer to walk free if they claim a gay man “came onto them”
US raises China steel taxes by 522%
Indefinite prison for suspect who won’t decrypt hard drives, feds say
German court bans public recital of anti-Erdogan poem
Iran wants U.S. to pay for 63 years of 'spiritual and material damage'

Dutch researchers are learning how to grow food on Mars and the Moon -- "Especially in the Martian soil, plants were growing very fast and very good. They even started to flower, something that we never anticipated"
Senate Passes 9/11 Bill Despite Saudi Threats
One of the missing Chibok girls has been found in Nigeria, activists say - the first since they were taken by Boko Haram militants two years ago.

Muslim states block gay groups from U.N. AIDS meeting: A group of 51 Muslim states has blocked 11 gay and transgender organizations from attending a high-level meeting at the UN next month on ending AIDS, sparking a protest by the US, Canada and the EU.
Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi’s right-hand man killed by Syrian Army in Deir Ezzor
Zika virus could spread to Europe in coming months, says WHO
Russia’s new FindFace app identifies strangers in a crowd with 70 percent accuracy
